subject: NVIDIA Exits China...
text:
### The Tech newsletter for Engineers who want to stay ahead

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/67300775-7738-44d1-a246-dd3e5c0d1713/The_Morning_Paper_for_AI___ML_Engineers_V2__1_.jpg?t=1759254145)
Follow image link: (https://magic.beehiiv.com/v1/5f7ce6e3-9a71-416b-99a7-606c5f7e2447?email=themnewsandstuff@gmail.com&redirect_to=https%3A%2F%2Fcodenewsletter.ai%2Fforms%2F14166360-de71-46c4-8722-878d417fab5c&utm_source=beehiiv&utm_campaign=VPSLCCALRN&redirect_delay=3&_bhiiv=opp_10a050e1-2722-43f8-b5e2-2eea52626c5f_94e90c2e&bhcl_id=02989d9e-e1f3-4799-8be1-203399c31800_1358dcaa-ca62-4a3e-96cd-c5ff13ec4abf_6234f2ce-90fd-4539-b098-42f6c1e01492)
Caption: 

Tech moves fast, but you're still playing catch-up?

That's exactly why 100K+ engineers working at Google, Meta, and Apple read [The Code](https://magic.beehiiv.com/v1/5f7ce6e3-9a71-416b-99a7-606c5f7e2447?email=themnewsandstuff@gmail.com&redirect_to=https%3A%2F%2Fcodenewsletter.ai%2Fforms%2F14166360-de71-46c4-8722-878d417fab5c&utm_source=beehiiv&utm_campaign=VPSLCCALRN&redirect_delay=3&_bhiiv=opp_10a050e1-2722-43f8-b5e2-2eea52626c5f_94e90c2e&bhcl_id=02989d9e-e1f3-4799-8be1-203399c31800_1358dcaa-ca62-4a3e-96cd-c5ff13ec4abf_6234f2ce-90fd-4539-b098-42f6c1e01492) twice a week.

Here's what you get:

* Curated tech news that shapes your career - Filtered from thousands of sources so you know what's coming 6 months early.

* Practical resources you can use immediately - Real tutorials and tools that solve actual engineering problems.

* Research papers and insights decoded - We break down complex tech so you understand what matters.

All delivered twice a week in just 2 short emails.

[Join 100K+ engineers](https://magic.beehiiv.com/v1/5f7ce6e3-9a71-416b-99a7-606c5f7e2447?email=themnewsandstuff@gmail.com&redirect_to=https%3A%2F%2Fcodenewsletter.ai%2Fforms%2F14166360-de71-46c4-8722-878d417fab5c&utm_source=beehiiv&utm_campaign=VPSLCCALRN&redirect_delay=3&_bhiiv=opp_10a050e1-2722-43f8-b5e2-2eea52626c5f_94e90c2e&bhcl_id=02989d9e-e1f3-4799-8be1-203399c31800_1358dcaa-ca62-4a3e-96cd-c5ff13ec4abf_6234f2ce-90fd-4539-b098-42f6c1e01492)

**How America Accidentally Turbocharged China's AI Chip Industry**

Listen, Nvidia just admitted they lost a $50 billion market basically overnight. Not because their chips got worse. Not because a competitor beat them. Because US policymakers decided to cut off China from advanced AI chips, and the whole thing backfired spectacularly.

Jensen Huang, Nvidia's CEO, just told everyone his company went from **95% market share in China to zero**. Complete wipeout. China was 20-25% of Nvidia's data center revenue?we're talking billions per quarter, just gone. And here's the kicker: instead of crippling China's AI development, we just gave them the strongest possible reason to build their own chips.

**The Timeline of How We Fucked This Up**

October 2022: Biden administration blocks Nvidia's best chips (A100, H100) from going to China. Nvidia responds like any smart company would?they create "watered-down" versions (H800, H20) that comply with the rules.

April 2025: Trump administration says "nah" and blocks those too. Then in August, they offer a deal: you can sell to China, but you pay us 15% of the revenue. Yeah, the US government literally tried to take a cut like some mob protection racket.

But China's regulators told their companies not to buy Nvidia chips anyway (security concerns), and by late August, Nvidia stopped H20 production entirely. Game over.

**What Actually Happened**

Remember how we thought cutting off chip access would slow China down? Instead:

**Cambricon Technologies** posted a 4,300% revenue surge in the first half of 2025. Not a typo. They went from losing money to making $144 million in profit.

**Huawei** is cranking out 600,000-650,000 Ascend chips this year, potentially 1.6 million by 2026.

Alibaba, Baidu, Tencent?they're all deploying domestic chips now. DeepSeek just released an AI model comparable to GPT-5 that's specifically optimized for Chinese chips.

China compressed what should've been a decade-long development cycle into 18 months of state-backed, hyper-focused innovation.

**The Revenge Play**

Oh, and China controls 90% of rare earth processing?the stuff you need to make literally every advanced chip and weapon system. In October 2025, they expanded export controls to 12 of 17 rare earth elements. Trump threatened a 100% tariff in response, then admitted it wasn't "sustainable."

We're in a full-blown escalation cycle now.

**Why This Matters**

The US tried to maintain AI dominance through hardware restrictions. Instead, we created permanent competitors who'll challenge us for decades. We handed China the motivation to become technologically independent?the exact opposite of what export controls were supposed to achieve.

And here's the wildest part: 47% of the world's top AI researchers are Chinese. We're cutting off half the global AI research community from American technology while simultaneously forcing them to build alternatives.

Jensen Huang called it perfectly: policies meant to harm China "oftentimes also harm America, and even worse."

Sometimes the biggest strategic mistakes don't look like mistakes until it's way too late.

Here are all the sources used in the research report:
